programme.title: Power & Politics: Ask the Mayor
programme.desc: Mayor Eric Adams speaks on current events and issues impacting our city and answers questions directly from News 12 viewers.

programme.title: Revealed
programme.desc: Explore the lush landscapes and hidden histories of Central Park, New York City's green heart.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the deputy commander of an Air National Guard Base is kidnapped, the team must work quickly to find the suspect along with stolen ammunition; Scola questions his own safety in the aftermath of a recent traumatic experience.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a trucker is gunned down after a routine trip from Canada, all signs point the team to a noted criminal on the FBI's Most Wanted Terrorists list; Jubal gets to work with an old friend and colleague, Detective Jack Lombardo.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: A drug dealer is shot in a federal park and the team sets out to look for his killer; Maggie's sister returns to New York and complicates the case.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: All eyes are on the team when it tries to find out who kidnapped the only child of a prominent U.S. senator; the abduction also uncovers a potential link to a similar case that was pushed to the side by local authorities.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After finding a group of teens dead from a drug overdose, the team races to find the dangerous dealer and his supplier; OA questions where he stands in his faith.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a prominent doctor is found dead in a ritualistic slaying, the team must race against time to hunt down a religiously motivated serial killer; Scola faces a life-or-death decision.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Hammer's on-again off-again flame is a Broadway star named Linda Fortunato, but her latest role is as primary suspect in the murder investigation of her ex-husband and co-star. The whole city is convinced of her guilt after the spatting couple was seen fighting during rehearsals, but Mike Hammer is determined to clear her name. Drama and mystery unfold while Hammer investigates a whole cast of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After being released from his time in prison, Mike Hammer's old friend Herman Simpson joins him for dinner. The discussion turns techie when Simpson brings up the computer revolution that is underway. However, a bank robbery involving this same technology-- and a suspiciously similar criminal --takes place the same evening. Simpson becomes the prime suspect, and Hammer is his only hope at staying free.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike's journalist friend, Pete, misses their scheduled meeting. But the apparent suicide raises questions that lead Mike to follow up on Pete's latest investigative assignment, an expos√© on surveillance. Hammer finds out that Pete was writing about the shadows and powers behind modern surveillance, an entity known as Big Brother. Now Hammer must track down the killer that's always watching everybody.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Deputy Mayor Barry Lawrence may be running for District Attorney on a "law and order" platform, but that doesn't mean that his conduct is always above board. When his mistress Tracy calls, she puts him in a compromising position. The police investigation stalls in what appears to be an attempt to cover up for the man Tracy's parents believe killed her--Barry Lawrence. Mike loves the idea of getting dirt on Barry, but a brawl with a cop leaves him conducting his investigation--with the help of his team--from a jail cell.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates potential links among a dead naval tech scientist, a surfer and an Internet video; Kensi and Deeks go under cover as they pursue suspects.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: As the team investigates the murder of a wealthy, retired CIA agent, Hetty's knowledge of the case is questioned.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Gunmen in costumes orchestrate a strange and brazen heist that could impact the U.S. economy; Granger insists on a partnership with a hesitant Kensi.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam, Callen, Deeks and Kensi spend Christmas on an aircraft carrier investigating an NCIS special agent's death; Eric and Nell celebrate the holidays at headquarters; Hetty goes on a trip.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: One of Deeks' former defendants is targeted for uncovering information that could dismantle a car shipping operation with ties to a global terrorist ring.

programme.desc: Firehouse 51 helps Herrmann put on a school fundraiser; Carver's troubled brother comes to town; a grateful citizen is determined to thank Brett and Severide for saving his life.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: An annoying floater takes a romantic interest in Violet; Ritter catches a local politician in a compromising position; Mouch and Severide help Trudy with an arson investigation.

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Cruz feels the burden of his increased responsibilities; Kidd, Gallo and Carver get caught in the middle of a gang war on a call; Herrmann wrangles Trudy for help lifting Cindy's mood.

programme.desc: A familiar face returns to Firehouse 51 to serve with Kidd on a special task force; with Tony close to breaking the CFD's perfect attendance record, Mouch and Capp work to keep him safe; old grudges resurface when Gallo reunites with a family member.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Boden, Ritter, Herrmann and Kidd work together to take down a local politician responsible for a chemical fire; after his aunt's accident, Gallo worries about their future; Brett steps in to perform Dylan's magic show when he's out of town.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Herrmann works on becoming a better man after Cindy's cancer journey; Kidd bonds with a homeless victim on a call; Kylie takes her firefighter exams; a harrowing call takes a toll on Brett.

programme.desc: Carver deals with the fallout of his arrest; Brett searches for closure with the baby she rescued; Capp weasels his way into the Firehouse 51 group chat.

programme.desc: The members of Firehouse 51 struggle to cope when one of their own dies in a fire; as Lts. Casey and Severide blame each other for the tragedy, Casey also secretly goes through a separation.

programme.desc: Severide hides his serious shoulder injury as he tries to rescue a construction worker from a collapsed building; two teens are trapped in a vehicle.

programme.desc: The H.E.A.T. must identify the person sent to assassinate a Chinese dissident---from a group of 146 guests at a resort hotel.

programme.title: Close Encounters with Evil

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Randy Hausner--brother of serial shooter Dale Hausner--shares the inside story of a man who terrorized the city of Phoenix in a year and a half-long killing spree.

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: Richard Beasley was a conman and serial killer who posed as a preacher and in 2011, posted advertisements on Craigslist to entice men to work with him on his farm.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Popular college senior Samantha Josephson goes missing after a night of socializing at a bar area popular with students; tragically, her body is found 24 hours later with more than 100 stab wounds.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: A 13-year-old doesn't show up for a play date and is reported missing, setting off a manhunt in the rough Colorado wilderness; when his badly decomposed remains are found by hikers three years later, prosecutors charge the teen's father with murder.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Police have few clues in the disappearance of University of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts until a local resident shares his garage surveillance camera footage; police later arrest Cristhian Bahena Rivera, who is living in the country illegally.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Although this edition of the Fall Classic represented a rematch of the 1942 World Series, there were some familiar faces missing from both the Cardinals and Yankees due to World War II.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Although the Yankees had beaten the Dodgers in their five previous World Series matchups, Brooklyn gave notice in Game 1 of the 1955 World Series that it wouldn't be dismissed so easily and went the distance to take home their first championship title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1960 matchup between the Pirates and the Yankees. Entering the bottom of the 9th inning of Game 7 tied at 9, Pirates second baseman Bill Mazeroski smashed a walk-off home run to crown the team as World Series champions

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Yankees and Giants are no strangers to World Series face-offs, but in 1962 the former cross-town rivals met in the Postseason for the first time since the Giants' move to San Francisco.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The 1964 World Series Film highlights Bob Gibon's complete-game effort against the Yankees

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1965 matchup between the Dodgers and the Twins. With Los Angeles and Minnesota tied at 3 games apiece, Hall of Famer Sandy Koufax twirled a stellar three-hit shutout to lift the Dodgers to their 4th World Series title

programme.title: Return of the Gunfighter
programme.desc: Ben Wyatt (Robert Taylor) is an aging gunfighter who has grown weary of his lifestyle. But when an old friend, Luis (Rodolfo Hoyos Jr.), asks for help defending his land, Ben can't say no. Unfortunately, he arrives too late, finding Luis and his entire family -- except daughter Anisa (Ana Mart√≠n) -- murdered. Ben is determined to get revenge against the killers, and in pursuing them reluctantly enlists the aid a younger gunfighter, Lee Sutton (Chad Everett).

programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fianc√©e Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and d√©cor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first day of this competition is at the Blackthorn Farm B&B on Anglesey, Wales, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week. On arrival, Dan and Rachel Lonergan take in the view, and Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor are feeling the vibes for their morning meditation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Graham and Barbara Yellow pride themselves on offering basic facilities for great value for money at the White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch find some hairs out of place in their room, while spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from being in room number four. Over dinner, Graham and Barbara relax into their roles, leaving Rachel Lonergan feeling guilty about having labelled them as game players.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor have an alternative approach to their business at The Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset. Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch think it will be a wigwam, while Rachel and Dan Lonergan are expecting a commune.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Leicester the team meet Paul, a personal trainer who would like to use his space for clients, as well as for relaxing with friends and family. Can the team give him an all-purpose garden that also takes into consideration his disability?

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: The team are in Ealing, west London, where they've taken on a small garden with a big problem. James and Sophie's neglected plot is only eight by four metres and is on two levels with a 1 metre drop. Can the team make such a tiny garden look bigger?

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Alan and his team of autists take on their biggest garden yet of a 95-foot jungle in south London owned by Zak and Eloise. The good news for the team is that they've got ¬£10,000 to spend on the transformation.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation‚Äôs gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson‚Äôs Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Hunting off the northeastern coast of Australia on Marble island could be one of the most beautiful sceneries in the world. Mark Peterson takes the 38 hour trip to Australia only to arrive in camp and have enough time to change and hit the ocean coastline looking for Axis & Javan Rusa deer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico chasing the Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. This subspecies has the smallest range of the 31 species in the deer slam. Mark is facing some grueling temps, bugs, and very low deer density. With the trip winding down, Mark and the guide decided to head back to the previous location where they had been seeing the most signs of deer. With only minutes left of shooting light, Mark‚Äôs target buck stepped out of the thicket.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn‚Äôt able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson‚Äôs trip to Australia is coming to a close. He still has one species on his bucket list: the Red Stag. Mark and the team head to high ground to seek an advantage on the elusive Red Stag. As they reach their vantage point, they run into a giant fallow deer that Mark couldn‚Äôt walk away from. After a successful harvest, they continue their quest for a Red Stag.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: If you ask Mark Peterson what his all time most memorable hunt is, he would likely say that it's anything he's done with his kids. That answer would quickly be followed up with "Blue Sheep Hunting in Pakistan, hands down". Here, Mark takes you back to 2017 to the first (and still only) filmed hunt for Blue Sheep in Northern Pakistan. It's ironic that his most challenging and physically brutal hunt is also the one that holds the number one spot in Mark's hunting career. Enjoy this second of three episodes as he pays tribute to Sheep Week, 2022. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: World Turkey Slam
programme.desc: This week on The Journey Within - A Bird Hunters Diary Mark takes another step closer to complete his World Turkey Slam. Up this week is the Merriam's species found at higher elevations and known for their white colors on the tail feathers. Western Nebraska has become a mecca to harvest the Merriam's Turkey.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson‚Äôs Journey in Argentina continues with some morning madness. Taking four animals, this is one of the best morning hunts he has had yet. After an already incredible week of hunting, Mark is looking for a few species that caught his attention earlier in the trip and turns up a Hybrid Sheep, Hybrid Mouflon, Feral Goat and a Multi Horn Sheep. Temps are abnormally hot in Argentina for this time of year and the animals will be heading for cover by mid day to stay cool. Mark and his guide Charley make a plan to cover a lot of ground in hopes of catching them out feeding before they disappear.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads south to Florida after an alligator. On this adventure, Mark is toting his Gunwerks BlastR handgun as he hunts the swamps with his sights set on a big mature gator. Alligators are typically judged in the field by looking at the distance from their eyes to the tip of their nose. The rule of thumb is that they grow a foot in length every year until they are eight years old, then grown an inch per year after that. At 13 feet 3 inches, this old gator is one for the books.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Hunting off the northeastern coast of Australia on Marble island could be one of the most beautiful sceneries in the world. Mark Peterson takes the 38 hour trip to Australia only to arrive in camp and have enough time to change and hit the ocean coastline looking for Axis & Javan Rusa deer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico chasing the Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. This subspecies has the smallest range of the 31 species in the deer slam. Mark is facing some grueling temps, bugs, and very low deer density. With the trip winding down, Mark and the guide decided to head back to the previous location where they had been seeing the most signs of deer. With only minutes left of shooting light, Mark‚Äôs target buck stepped out of the thicket.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn‚Äôt able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson‚Äôs trip to Australia is coming to a close. He still has one species on his bucket list: the Red Stag. Mark and the team head to high ground to seek an advantage on the elusive Red Stag. As they reach their vantage point, they run into a giant fallow deer that Mark couldn‚Äôt walk away from. After a successful harvest, they continue their quest for a Red Stag.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: If you ask Mark Peterson what his all time most memorable hunt is, he would likely say that it's anything he's done with his kids. That answer would quickly be followed up with "Blue Sheep Hunting in Pakistan, hands down". Here, Mark takes you back to 2017 to the first (and still only) filmed hunt for Blue Sheep in Northern Pakistan. It's ironic that his most challenging and physically brutal hunt is also the one that holds the number one spot in Mark's hunting career. Enjoy this second of three episodes as he pays tribute to Sheep Week, 2022. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The last hunt in this series takes us to Texas in February of 2017. This time Mark is after his first Aoudad with a muzzleloader. Aoudad were introduced to Texas as an exotic species and it didn't take long for them to establish a large viable population in the ideal habitat that West Texas offers. Going into this hunt with the confidence and extended range that only Gunwerks can provide, Mark knows the odds are in his favor and it doesn't take long to come across multiple bands of rams. Thanks for following along in this 3 part series as we looked back on some of Mark's most memorable hunts for these incredible animals found all over the world. Click the link below to join and learn more about The Wild Sheep Foundation.

Up this week is the Merriam's species found at higher elevations and known for their white colors on the tail feathers. Western Nebraska has become a mecca to harvest the Merriam's Turkey.

Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fianc√©e, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man

programme.title: Beyond Mombasa

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: Pal Joey

programme.title: Hamlet

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf Takes a Chance
programme.desc: A former jewel thief (Warren William) is accused of murder after betting the police inspector that he can stay out of trouble for 24 hours.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they‚Äôre the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: A Man's Castle
programme.desc: In this Depression-era drama, the gruff and homeless Bill (Spencer Tracy) decides to help out the beautiful, destitute Trina (Loretta Young). Trina falls for Bill, and they set up house together in a shantytown, but he longs to get out of New York City and hit the open road. When Trina discovers she's pregnant, Bill plans to rob a toy store with a shifty drifter named Bragg (Arthur Hohl) in order to leave her with money. But will the scheme pan out?

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend‚Äôs marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Thomasine & Bushrod
programme.desc: In this beloved Blaxploitation flick set in 1911, a team of thieves steal from wealthy capitalists, to return their riches to deserving families.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: The New Daughters of Joshua Cabe

programme.title: A Time for Killing
programme.desc: After Capt. Dorrit Bentley (George Hamilton) and his fellow Confederate troops escape from a Union prison, Maj. Wolcott (Glenn Ford) sets out to recapture the fugitives. As protection, the Southern escapees abduct Wolcott's lovely fianc√©e, Emily Biddle (Inger Stevens), and head toward Mexico. On their way to the border, they kill a Northern messenger bearing word that the Civil War is over and keep this information to themselves, resulting in more conflict with Union soldiers.

programme.title: Return of the Durango Kid

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anch√≥riz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.desc: Mac and the team follow mercenaries who are transporting stolen lethal nerve gas; Jack confronts Elwood about Riley; Bozer is pushed to his limit in spy school.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac must help college students stranded on a research ship in the Arctic Ocean; Jack kidnaps Elwood to find out what he's up to; Bozer's feelings toward Leanna grow stronger.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: The LAPD interrupts the team's Christmas celebration to arrest Mac for terrorism when they find a body in a building destroyed by a bomb Mac built.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team tracks an increasingly devolving killer to Arizona; the team suspects Hotch is in the running to be the unit chief.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As the hunt for a ritualistic killer continues, a bizarre familial connection could help the team zero in on the suspect.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team must determine if the anniversary of the Kennedy assassination is a motivating factor when a sniper strikes Dallas.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team meets the new section chief (Esai Morales), who shares a long history with J.J.; an unknown subject leaves victims unable to communicate.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: As Hotch fights for his life after being stabbed, he has visions of his late wife and his nemesis; when a teen goes missing, suspicions arise about her estranged father.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Ritualistic murders lead the team to believe their suspect may have a fascination with the Salem witch trials; Garcia plans a Day of the Dead celebration.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A series of strangulations leads the team to look for a killer who keeps mementos of his victims; Rossi's favorite bar is in danger of closing.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for missing teens who are suspects in a series of mass murders in Chicago.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When skeletons are discovered in the backyard of a home in Virginia, family secrets and past racial divisions are brought to light.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a young boy disappears from his home in St. Louis, the team examines a similar cold case for clues.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy landowner Gregory Lancaster's body goes missing on the night of his death, a sinister web of secrets and lies is exposed in the village of Little Malton. DCI Barnaby, DS Nelson and new Forensic Pathologist Kam Karimore are drawn into a macabre world of body-snatching as they seek to identify the villain.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Mysterious lights are seen in the sky over famous UFO hot-spot Cooper Hill. When a local forest-ranger suffers a strange death the visiting UFO spotters are convinced aliens are responsible. DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson unearth suspicions, betrayals and long-buried secrets in their search for the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While Troy assists an attractive wildlife liaison officer with an investigation into the illegal sale of protected bird eggs, Barnaby travels to Midsomer Magna to investigate the sudden death of a man, who apparently drowned himself. While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Across logging country, the final push begins. At Papac, Joe Linderborg's reign on the yarder has everyone running scared.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: It's the final week of Ax Men, and as the clock counts down, tempers heat up.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac returns as reigning king of the mountain; a gruesome accident puts Shelby Stanga dead in the water; a new yarder company joins the competition.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga is hired to remove a log from private property; infighting reaches a fever pitch at S&S Aqua Logging; a familiar face returns to Papac; Gabe Rygaard takes Dave out cutting.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy Smith is smitten with his new assistant; Uncle Buck and Swilley push their equipment to the breaking point; Shelby Stanga scouts his newest log order; Big Gun Logging faces an uncertain future when Levi Brown goes to the hospital.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A yarder operator at Papac Alaska walks off in the middle of the day; Swilley's determination to beat S&S in the Suwannee River Log Off leads to a life threatening mistake; Big Gun Logging loses control of the Ole Keasy site.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Start-up outfit Big Gun Logging hits a snag as their deadline approaches; Buck & Swilley make a run for the lead in the log-off; Jimmy deals with a crew crisis; Shelby Stanga enlists the help of a voodoo team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga and a massive tree fight to the death; the bad blood between Dave and Fernando boils over; two of Papac's machines get tangled up; Buck and Swilley raise the stakes; Siderius Logging gambles on life and limb.

programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a look back at 130 episodes of Duck Dynasty,

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil, Willie and Ms. Kay attempt to produce a cooking video for their fans.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a big business decision must be made affecting Duck Commander, Willie plans an employee retreat.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski confronts a creek that's thawed in the middle of the road. On an important run for Polar, Art Burke receives news that could be devastating.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the end of the record short season nears, Polar Boss Mark Kohaykewych makes an historic deal with rivals Darrell Ward and Lisa Kelly.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The historic four truck convoy faces fire and a crossing so thin, they must test the thickness themselves.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice is right! Following two short seasons, the drivers are ready for what is forecasted to be a cold and busy winter.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice road season is off to a bad start. Legendary trucker Alex Debogorski gets more than he bargained for when he falls through a patch of thin ice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A sudden warm up threatens to derail the ice road season just as it kicks into high gear. Alex Debogorski encounters a mystery man walking alone on an isolated winter road.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After rising temperatures close the ice roads the drivers are stranded and praying for a freeze.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Mark and Lisa call in Reno Ward, the 23 year-old son of the late Darrell Ward, hoping his father's tutelage--and DNA--will help them meet this unprecedented challenge.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A small convoy heads out on the winter roads with a giant oversized load. The treacherous journey over nearly impossible terrain will be the ultimate test of skill.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice roads are at their meanest and slickest when Reno Ward has a disastrous encounter with a speeding pick-up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski is moving a construction shack that might be too heavy for the ice, so the veteran trucker uses a steel sled to drag the huge haul across a frozen lake.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A volatile season is winding down and it seems like trouble comes in doubles. Lisa Kelly and Steph Custance barely get by when they team up for safe passage on the icy terrain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The spring thaw is in full melt mode as the drivers get one last lick before the ice roads close for the season.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Take a look at the men who undertake one of the most dangerous jobs on earth--ice road truckers.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Jay hauls a 17-ton water tank over 31 inches of ice all the way to the De Beers Diamond mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: An arctic storm forces a road closure. Alex hauls a 44,000 pound diamond ore crusher across 350-miles of ice to the BHP mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.
